**Solution**:

Define the column vector of coefficients as $\vec{b} = (
`r round(coef(weight_lm)[2],2)` , 
`r round(coef(weight_lm)[1],1)`
)$. Let $\vec{y}$ be the column vector $(y_1, \dots, y_{100})$ and let 
\[
\mat{X} = \begin{bmatrix}
x_1 & 1 \\
\vdots & \vdots \\
x_{100} & 1
\end{bmatrix}
\] 
We obtain $\vec{b}$ using the equation $$\vec{b} = (\mat{X}^\transpose \mat{X})^{-1}\mat{X}^\transpose\vec{y}$$
